skill.name: creating-skills
skill.description:
Guides creation of effective Agent Skills with proper structure and validation.
Use when users want to create a new skill, update an existing skill, or need
guidance on skill design patterns, SKILL.md format, or verify.py implementation.
NOT when just using existing skills (use those skills directly).
skill.summary:
Guides creation of effective Agent Skills with proper structure and validation.
Use when users want ...
skill.author: Asmayaseen

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with bundled helper scripts. Scripts only create files in user-specified paths with no network access or credential handling. Safe for publication with standard caution about executing scripts.

content.value_statement: Creating skills for Claude requires understanding skill anatomy, validation requirements, and design patterns. This skill provides step-by-step guidance and reusable scripts to bootstrap and validate new skills with proper structure.
actual_capabilities: Guides skill creation workflow from concept to packaged skill
Provides init_skill.py to bootstrap new skill directories
Provides package_skill.py to create distributable .skill files
Provides verify.py to validate skill structure against constitution
Documents design patterns including progressive disclosure and two-stage review
Teaches effective frontmatter and trigger description writing
limitations: Does not execute skills on your behalf - guides you through creating them
Does not handle skill distribution or publishing to registries
Does not include runtime execution environment for skills
Does not provide pre-built skills - only guidance for creating them

use_cases.title: Build Custom Skills
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills that extend Claude with domain expertise and custom workflows.

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Skills
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill structure and validation across team skill repositories.

use_cases.title: Package Skill Resources
use_cases.description: Bundle scripts, references, and assets into distributable skill packages.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to create a new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [use case]. Walk me through the skill creation process using the creating-skills skill.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my skill at [path/to/skill] using the creating-skills skill. Check frontmatter, structure, and verify.py.

prompt_templates.title: Package Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Package my skill at [path/to/skill] into a .skill file using the creating-skills skill packaging scripts.

prompt_templates.title: Design Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: What design pattern should I use for a skill that [use case]? Review the design-patterns.md reference from creating-skills.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for generating API documentation
output: ‚Ä¢ Run init_skill.py to bootstrap the skill structure
‚Ä¢ SKILL.md will be created with frontmatter and TODO placeholders
‚Ä¢ Decide between workflow, task-based, or reference patterns
‚Ä¢ Add scripts/ for documentation generation utilities
‚Ä¢ Add references/ for API schema documentation
‚Ä¢ Run verify.py to validate before packaging

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md body under 500 lines - split content into references/ for complex skills
Write descriptions as triggering conditions only, not workflow summaries
Use progressive disclosure - load resources only when Claude determines they are needed
Run verify.py before packaging to catch frontmatter and structure issues early
anti_patterns: Including workflow summaries in the description - causes Claude to skip reading the full skill
Adding unneeded directories - skills should contain only essential files
Creating README.md, INSTALLATION_GUIDE.md, or CHANGELOG.md - keep SKILL.md self-contained
Ignoring verification failures - stop and fix errors before proceeding

faq.question: What tools support Agent Skills?
faq.answer: Claude Code, Claude, and Codex all support the skill format. Skills are portable across platforms.

faq.question: What is the maximum skill name length?
faq.answer: Skill names must be 40 characters or less, using hyphen-case (lowercase letters, digits, hyphens).

faq.question: Can I use scripts from other skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Copy scripts from existing skills into your scripts/ directory. Scripts can be executed without loading into context.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these scripts?
faq.answer: Scripts only create files in paths you specify. No network calls, no credential access, no data exfiltration.

faq.question: Why does verification fail?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing YAML frontmatter, missing name or description, invalid name format, or missing 'Use when' trigger.

faq.question: How is this different from MCP servers?
faq.answer: Skills are prompt-based guidance with bundled resources. MCP servers are tool-based integrations. Skills complement MCP tools.
